content.key_points:
**CONCEPT** Dehydration has more severe effects on infants because their body water approaches 80% of their body weight.

**Degrees of dehydration**

**Mild** – less than 5% weight loss
**Moderate** - 5% to 10% weight loss
**Severe** – more than 10% weight loss

**PRIORITY: Maintain Hydration**

questions.question_text: After initial triage, the following clients were referred to the nurse. Which client should the nurse attend to first?
options: 1. An 80-year-old female with no tears while moaning and crying due to abdominal cramps
2. A 7-year-old boy with two episodes of diarrhea in the last hour
3. An 8-month-old baby with three episodes of diarrhea in the last hour
4. A 3-week-old infant with no tears while crying
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE** An 8-month-old baby with 3 episodes of diarrhea in the last hour is at risk for dehydration because their body weight approaches 80% of body weight while an average adult has 60%.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete concept extracted from left side of PDF page 20
extraction_metadata.reference: The Lippincott Manual of Nursing Practice Philippine Edition, Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
